abstract: The Yankees' division series is governed by a league policy that says games can only be suspended, not canceled, and that no doubleheaders will be permitted.
snippet: The Yankees' division series is governed by a league policy that says games can only be suspended, not canceled, and that no doubleheaders will be permitted.
lead_paragraph: Updated | 5:22 p.m. In his pregame comments, Manager Joe Girardi was asked if he would be hesitant to start the game if there was rain in the forecast for 9:30 or 10 p.m., and he said, "Unfortunately, I don't get to make that decision. That's in MLB's hands. I would highly recommend that we don't start if it's going to rain half an hour, 45 minutes, an hour. But I'm not making the decisions."

headline.main: Different Rules for Rainy Weather in Playoffs
